chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robbie K Cornils was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence presently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and follow through counseling.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, work search or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Defendant Robbie K Cornils appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Nathan J. Heim for Robbie K Cornils appeared by video, Attorney Jill L. Vendetti for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
Inducement: Letter dated March 8, 2022
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings. 
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar. The defendant is requesting substitution and it will be subsequently filed. Offer deadline is set for April 29, 2022 at 8:30 a.m. 
Further proceedings will be scheduled when a new judge is assigned.
Nathan Heim, Public Defender.

09:55 AM Defendant Robbie K Cornils appeared by video, Special appearance by Attorney Ann Larson on behalf of the defendant,  Attorney Jill L. Vendetti appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
RE: OWI (7th), OAR on 02-20-2022.
Blood Search Warrant-Section 968.12, Wisconsin Statutes; Affidavit in Support of Blood Search Warrant; Return of Search Warrant by Law Enforcement Officer.
Blood Search Warrant-Section 968.12, Wisconsin Statutes; Affidavit in Support of Blood Search Warrant; Return of Search Warrant by Law Enforcement Officer.
Prints to MTPD.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish $10,000 Cash Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of OWI (7th).  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-09-2022 at 9:30 a.m. in Branch 2.  Bail is set at $10,000 cash bail with the conditions that he  is to have no contact with any business whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol and he is not to operate a motor vehicle. The court also orders that the defendant report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. 
Minutes.
